reasoning: Temporal lobe epilepsy (TLE) is the most common form of focal epilepsy, accounting for 40-60% of all focal epilepsy cases. Using global epilepsy prevalence of ~5-10 per 1000 (5,000-10,000 per 100k) with TLE representing ~40% of focal cases estimates prevalence at ~3,500 per 100k. Prevalence metric appropriate for chronic lifelong condition.
source: Kwan P et al. (2009). Definition, classification, and unmet needs in epilepsy. Lancet. 373(9680):1900-1910
